alert.note: Alert for Butler (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 10:43PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest Ohio, including the following county, Butler. * WHEN...Until 145 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1043 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Oxford, Monroe, Trenton, Ross, Seven Mile, Darrtown, Williamsdale, Dunlap, Reily, New Miami, Millville, Somerville, Jacksonburg, Mcgonigle, Collinsville, Layhigh and St. Charles.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
